top_categories.workout_context: BWR Arizona’s desert gravel, technical singletrack demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing BWR Arizona isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 104 miles, BWR Arizona punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
BWR Arizona’s desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
BWR Arizona rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at BWR Arizona — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at BWR Arizona when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of BWR Arizona. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at BWR Arizona — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock.
Every session at BWR Arizona intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what BWR Arizona’s desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock delivers on race day.
BWR Arizona’s 6,600ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for BWR Arizona’s 104 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at BWR Arizona. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at BWR Arizona demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: desert gravel, technical singletrack, sand. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 104 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Durability to prepare you for 104 miles of desert gravel, singletrack, sand, rock in Cave Creek / McDowell Region, Arizona.
